business.headline: Osamu Suzuki conferred with Padma Vibhushan for contribution to auto industryOsamu Suzuki, former Chairman of Suzuki Motor Corporation and ex-Director & Honorary Chairman of Maruti Suzuki India Limited, was posthumously honoured with the Padma Vibhushan, the country's second-highest civilian award.

Sensex, Nifty close flat after volatile trade as border tensions weigh on marketThe S&P BSE Sensex added 70 points to close at 80,288.38, while the NSE Nifty50 just managed to end in green, adding 7.45 points to close at 24,335.95.

Sebi probes Ola Electric's sales data disclosures: ReportThe matter came into focus after a big gap was seen between the vehicle registration data on the government's VAHAN portal and the sales numbers shared by the company.

Terror's price tag: How the Pahalgam attack could hit Pakistan's economyAlready struggling with a weak economy, Pakistan now faces even tougher times ahead as India's retaliatory steps threaten to break crucial economic links.

Infosys sacks 195 trainees over failed internal tests: ReportThe move marks the fourth such round of trainee terminations at India's second-largest IT services company, which is grappling with weak demand and flat revenue projections for the current fiscal year.

Dalal Street faces high volatility, but there is good news for investorsBy mid-morning, the Sensex was up around 100 points and holding above 80,302, while the Nifty50 traded above 24,300. That resilience marks a big shift from just a few weeks ago when even a whisper of bad news could send stocks crashing.
Explained: Why are gold prices not rising any moreGlobally, gold prices also dropped nearly 1%. Spot gold was down 0.8% at $3,314.99 an ounce, while US gold futures lost 0.7% to $3,325.10.

Ather Energy IPO Day 2: Check latest subscription details, GMP and key datesAther Energy IPO Day 2: The IPO will remain open till April 30, giving investors a couple more days to weigh their options. Ather's offering is a combination of fresh shares and an offer-for-sale from existing investors.

Gensol Engineering shares hit 52-week low after ED raids officesGensol ED raid: The company's stock continued to face heavy selling pressure, falling to Rs 81.36, which is its 52-week low. Gensol shares have now lost over 50% of their value in the last one month and nearly 90% over the past six months.

Explained: Why Tata Motors, Samvardhana Motherson and other auto stocks are risingBy 9:50 am, Tata Motors shares were up 1.2% at Rs 676.45, while Samvardhana Motherson gained 1.4% to Rs 136.85 on the Bombay Stock Exchange. Although some of the early gains were trimmed by profit booking, the auto sector stood out in an otherwise cautious market. Sona BLW shares were trading 3.2% higher at Rs 478.10.

Reliance shares are gaining momentum after strong Q4. Can the rally last?Following the Q4 result announcement, RIL stock jumped nearly 5%. Even today, the stock has jumped 1.5% in early trade. Now the question is: is this just a relief rally — or the start of something bigger?

Sensex, Nifty extend winning run boosted by FII buying; Tata Motors gains 2%The S&P BSE Sensex jumped 419.40 points to 80,637.41, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 122.45 points to 24,450.95 as of 9:24 am.

entertainment.headline: Ajith Kumar on Padma Bhushan honour: Still plain middle class at heartTamil actor Ajith Kumar was honoured with the Padma Bhushan on Monday. In an exclusive conversation with India Today, the 'Vidaamuyarchi' actor described the recognition as "surreal and overwhelming".

SRK in talks with Marvel Studios for Hollywood debut? Viral post sparks buzzShah Rukh Khan is set to make his Hollywood debut. The superstar is in talks with Marvel Studios for a potential role in the MCU.

Weak Hero Class 2 review: K-drama packs solid punch despite weak character arcsReleased-Fri Apr 25, 2025Weak Hero Class 2 review: Park Ji-hoon is back with a bang in the sequel to the popular K-drama adapted from manhwa, but the series compromises on character arcs to reach a hurried end.

Kesari Veer trailer: Sooraj Pancholi is Rajput warrior Hamirji Gohil in period dramaThe trailer of 'Kesari Veer', an upcoming period drama based on the life of Hamirji Gohil, is out. The titular character is played by actor Sooraj Pancholi.

Suniel Shetty condemns terrorism, says 'some can't see Kashmir progressing post-370'Actor Suniel Shetty talked about terrorism in Kashmir in the wake of the Pahalgam terror attack. He appreciated the government's efforts to bring normalcy and progress in the Valley, but also slammed those who don't want Kashmir to grow.

Actor Nani reacts strongly to Pahalgam attack: Just take the terrorists outTelugu actor Nani, in an exclusive conversation with India Today, opened up about the Pahalgam terror attack. He said that there's only one way to combat terrorism and that is to wipe them out.

Mahesh Babu flaunts curly long hair look for SSMB 29 in new pics, fans reactMahesh Babu's latest photos have taken over the internet. Fans were excited to see him in a never-seen-before look for his upcoming film, 'SSMB 29', with director SS Rajamouli.

Miss our jhal muri: Shoojit Sircar squeezes his heart into tearful note to IrrfanOn Irrfan's fifth death anniversary, filmmaker Shoojit Sircar posted an emotional letter recalling their cherished memories and the lasting love for the late actor.
Babil Khan's emotional tribute to father Irrfan on death anniversaryActor Babil Khan shared an adorable post on his father and iconic actor Irrfan's death anniversary.

Dipika Kakar condemns Pahalgam terror attack: Why such anger?Actor Dipika Kakar condemned the recent Pahalgam terror attack. The actor, in her latest vlog, expressed her grief and condoled the death of innocent people.

Emraan Hashmi says 'terrorism has no religion', seeks Pahalgam attack 'payback'Actor Emraan Hashmi comments on the security at the Baisaran meadow during the terrorist attack. He also talks about solidarity, highlighting that no religion teaches violence.

Nani denies Salman's South ignores Bollywood claim: How did they turn superstars?Actor Nani dismissed Salman Khan's statement about the South audience not watching Bollywood films due to their loyalty to South superstars. He clarified that it's not possible for Khan and other actors from Bollywood to become such huge stars without being popular in the South.

When actor Nani manifested his dream role in SS Rajamouli's MahabharataActor Nani, who once expressed his desire to play Arjun in a cinematic adaptation of Mahabharata, has been confirmed by filmmaker SS Rajamouli to join the cast of his much-anticipated project.

Tamil actor Vijay Antony clarifies 'Pakistanis seek peace' remarkTamil actor-director Vijay Antony issued a statement to clarify his 'Pakistanis seek peace' comment. He emphasised unity during troubling times.

Jr NTR and Prashanth Neel's film to release in June 2026It's official! Telugu superstar Jr NTR and filmmaker Prashanth Neel's much-awaited film 'NTRNeel' is slated for a June 2026 release. The actor made the annoucment on April 29.

Actor Aarti Singh renews wedding vows, husband Dipak Chauhan touches her feetActor Aarti Chauhan renewed her wedding vows on her first anniversary. In a video from the celebration, her husband, Dipak Chauha, is seen touching her feet.

After Monkey Man, Dev Patel to direct and star in revenge-thriller The PeasantAfter directing and acting in 'Monkey Man', actor-director Dev Patel is gearing up for his next, a revenge-thriller. Titled 'The Peasant', the upcoming film is backed by Fifth Season and Thunder Road.

SRK hugs emotional fans, signs autographs, clicks selfies on Germany tripShah Rukh Khan recently delighted his fans by signing autographs, posing for photos, and sharing warm hugs during his recent trip to Germany. Several videos of the actor with his fans have gone viral.

Saif Ali Khan 'hated' himself on first day of Jewel Thief shoot, says he was 'lost'Actor Saif Ali Khan admitted that he didn't know what he was doing on the first day of shooting for 'Jewel Thief'. 'Jewel Thief' premiered on Netflix on April 25 and also stars Jaideep Ahlawat.

general news.headline: PM holds key security meet, Defence Minister, NSA, Chief of Defence Staff present Live UpdatesPM Modi's high-level meeting with the top defence establishment came as India mulls options to punish those behind the April 22 Pahalgam attack, the worst terror strike on civilians in India since the 26/11 Mumbai carnage.

Pahalgam zip line operator chanting Allahu Akbar natural reaction: NIA sourcesNIA sources said that it is natural to say 'Allahu Akbar' in reaction to something shocking or sudden and that it's the same as Hindus saying 'Hey Ram'.

'Terror will never defeat India's spirit': Tourists defy fear, return to PahalgamThe Pahalgam carnage, which left 25 tourists and a Kashmiri dead, wasn't just an attack on civilians but a strike at an industry that is the lifeline of Kashmir.

Terror's price tag: How the Pahalgam attack could hit Pakistan's economyAlready struggling with a weak economy, Pakistan now faces even tougher times ahead as India's retaliatory steps threaten to break crucial economic links.

A Carneyval for India-Canada ties after K-flop?Liberal Party leader Mark Carney is all set to start a full term as Canada's Prime Minister. All through, Carney tried to distance himself from his predecessor, Justin Trudeau, who turned Indo-Canadian ties chilly. With pro-Khalistani NDP leader Jagmeet Singh out of the way, and the economist and investor in Carney aware of India's economic value, will Canada's ties with India see an upswing?

Bengaluru restaurant valets without licences crash Rs 1.4 crore car making reelsThree valets with a Bengaluru restaurant crashed a Rs 1.4 crore luxury SUV while filming reels. According to the vehicle's owner, the restaurant first dismissed it as a parking accident, but it turned out to be a part of a larger coverup to hide that drivers didn't have valid licences.

Gunshot heard in new Pahalgam video as children hop on trampoline, tourist ziplinesAnother video shot in Baisaran meadow on the day of the heinous Pahalgam terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir on April 22 has surfaced online. It shows a woman on a zipline when gunshots can be heard in the background.

Pahalgam mastermind likely received elite commando training in Pak: SourcesHashim Musa, identified as the mastermind behind the killing of 26 people in Pahalgam, is believed to be a former soldier trained as a Pakistani para commando.

Forget Indus waters, Pakistan has huge canal crisis at homeMassive protests in Sindh have forced the Pakistani government to shelve an Indus canals project that was reportedly intended to serve the interests of the army. Despite the government's announcement, people haven't lifted a blockade of the highways in Sindh, cutting off Punjab and transport to and from the Karachi Port. A lakh truckers and helpers are stranded, and fresh woe grips Pakistan's tattered economy.

Why attack on SP MP Ramji Lal Suman's convoy is a law and order red flag for UPThe Samajwadi Party leader has been in the crosshairs of the Karni Sena and other Rajput groups ever since his comments on the community's icon Rana Sanga and Babur

Two terrorists at entry gate, 1 at exit, he fired first: What happened in PahalgamSources said the Pahalgam attack, which left 25 tourists and a Kashmiri dead, was carried out by four terrorists. While two came through the entry gate, one was stationed at the exit gate.

He ran in fear: Brother of Pahalgam zipline operator who chanted 'Allahu Akbar'The zipline operator's brother, Mukhtar, vehemently asserted his sibling's innocence. He claimed Muzammil fled for his life at the first sign of danger and had no prior knowledge of the impending attack.

Terrorism in Kashmir: Nine years of calm before icy stormIn part 2 of our series on the history of terrorism in Kashmir, we revisit the calm before the storm that prevailed from 1980 to the summer of 1989.

Pakistani woman in Hyderabad wants to stay in India on humanitarian groundBadar Jahan, who was born in India but acquired Pakistani citizenship, sought to stay in India, citing poor health and family ties. Her daughter also urged the government to make a humanitarian exception amid.

Live: High-level at PM's residence over Pahalgam attack ends after over one hourPahalgam Attack Live Updates: Tensions between India and Pakistan escalated after a terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam claimed 26 lives. India took strong diplomatic measures against the neighbouring country after The Resistance Front, an offshoot of a Pakistan-based terror group Laskar-e-Taiba, claimed the attack. The ceasefire along the LoC was violated on the Pak side for the fifth straight night on April 29, prompting strong retaliation from the Indian Army.

Supreme Court orders CBI to probe 'unholy' builder-bank nexus in Delhi-NCRCiting how builders and banks have "taken poor homebuyers to ransom", the Supreme Court ordered CBI to conduct a probe against prominent developer Supertech and other realty firms in the National Capital Region.
Lashkar-e-Pakistan Congress: BJP fumes over headless poster dig at PMThe BJP came down heavily upon Congress for sharing a headless poster to take a dig at PM Modi after the Pahalgam attack.

How to make Pakistan pay for Pahalgam carnage: The hard optionsFrom missile attacks to surgical strikes and diplomatic pressure, each action will come with consequences, and not just for our recalcitrant neighbour.

Inhumane: Mehbooba Mufti on deportation of Pakistanis married to IndiansFormer J&K Chief Minister Mehbooba Mufti urged the Centre to reconsider its decision to deport those Pakistani nationals who have been married to Indians and have been living here for 30–40 years.

'Terrorists should be punished, not us': Tears at Pak border as families separateAt the Wagah-Attari border, heartbreaking scenes played out as several Pakistani nationals shared their concerns  and appealed to India to reconsider their decision.

Raja Ravi Varma: The story of God's and Goddesses' first paintingsRaja Ravi Varma, often called India's king of kitsch, crossed the narrow lines of courtly painting. He brought the gods from temples to the walls of the masses, shaping their form through paint and print both. Doing so, he stirred the stagnant waters of tradition, choosing not to gratify the few, but to speak to the many.
J&K's beauty on lockdown: 48 tourist sites closed, Srinagar hit hardestThe ban affects 55 per cent of tourist destinations in Jammu and Kashmir, including several iconic and much-loved spots.

Indian Army foils Pak-based actors' cyberspace breach attemptA cyberattack by a Pakistani group named "IOK Hacker" targeting the Indian Army was successfully foiled, officials said. No damage was reported to any sensitive or operational network.

Delhi cabinet clears bill to regulate fee hike across all 1,677 schoolsDelhi cabinet has passed a draft bill to regulate fees in private and aided schools after numerous parent complaints and protests.

sports.headline: Rana, Rawal star as India thump South Africa by 15 runs in Women's Tri seriesIndia women continued their victory run in the women's tri series as they beat South Africa women by 15 runs in the second match in Colombo. Sneh Rana was adjudged Player of the Match for picking her maiden five wicket haul in ODIs.

Sanjiv Goenka shares Vaibhav Suryavanshi's photo supporting his old team in 2017Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) owner Sanjiv Goenka shared a throwback picture of Vaibhav Suryavanshi, supporting his old team Rising Pune Super Giants from 2017. Suryavanshi etched his name in record books with his breathtaking hundred against Gujarat Titans (GT).

MMA to make its Asian Games debut in 2026 in Japan, cricket retains placeAsian Games 2026: Mixed Martial Arts will make its Asian Games debut in Japan and will feature six events. Cricket will continue to be part of the continental multi-sport spectacle, scheduled to be held from September 19 to October 4.

Chahal gets Dhoni's bat, but Maxwell trolls him: You are always subbedGlenn Maxwell trolled Yuzvendra Chahal right after the spinner was able to get hold of MS Dhoni's bat ahead of the clash between CSK and PBKS at Chepauk on April 30.

Bihar CM announces Rs 10 lakh for Vaibhav Suryavanshi after record IPL centuryIPL 2025, RR vs GT: Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar announced prize money for 14-year-old Vaibhav Suryavanshi, who broke the record for the youngst to hit a T20 hundred. The 14-year-old smashed a 38-ball 101 for Rajasthan Royals against Gujarat Titans on Monday, April 28.

Premier League opens office in Mumbai to promote football in IndiaThe English Premier League has announced the opening of an office in Mumbai, India, which will build on the league's longstanding efforts to promote football in India.

Watch: Emotional Vaibhav Suryavanshi calls elated father after IPL hundredAn emotional Vaibhav Suryavanshi decided to call his father first after scoring his maiden IPL hundred for RR in their win over GT on Monday, April 28.

AIFF asks Churchill Brothers to return I-League trophyDespite a stay order from the Court of Arbitration for Sport (CAS), the All India Football Federation (AIFF) on Monday demanded that Churchill Brothers return the I-League title previously awarded to them.

Prithvi Shaw named in T20 Mumbai League icon players list with Suryakumar, ShreyasPrithvi Shaw has been named amongst the 8 icon players unveiled for the upcoming season of the T20 Mumbai League 2025 on Tuesday, April 29. The tournament will start on May 26.

Let Vaibhav play: Ravi Shastri predicts next challenge for RR youngsterFormer India head coach Ravi Shastri has called for patience with Rajasthan Royals' teenage sensation Vaibhav Suryavanshi, even as the cricket world continues to marvel at his record-breaking hundred in the IPL.

Premier League opens office in Mumbai to promote football in IndiaThe English Premier League has announced the opening of an office in Mumbai, India, which will build on the league's longstanding efforts to promote football in India.

Watch: Emotional Vaibhav Suryavanshi calls elated father after IPL hundredAn emotional Vaibhav Suryavanshi decided to call his father first after scoring his maiden IPL hundred for RR in their win over GT on Monday, April 28.

AIFF asks Churchill Brothers to return I-League trophyDespite a stay order from the Court of Arbitration for Sport (CAS), the All India Football Federation (AIFF) on Monday demanded that Churchill Brothers return the I-League title previously awarded to them.

Prithvi Shaw named in T20 Mumbai League icon players list with Suryakumar, ShreyasPrithvi Shaw has been named amongst the 8 icon players unveiled for the upcoming season of the T20 Mumbai League 2025 on Tuesday, April 29. The tournament will start on May 26.

Let Vaibhav play: Ravi Shastri predicts next challenge for RR youngsterFormer India head coach Ravi Shastri has called for patience with Rajasthan Royals' teenage sensation Vaibhav Suryavanshi, even as the cricket world continues to marvel at his record-breaking hundred in the IPL.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
